pageContext.claim: “The system is full. Can't take anymore. Sorry, folks. Can't take anymore. Asylum -- you know, I look at some of these asylum people; they're gang members. They're not afraid of anything.”
pageContext.analysis: The immigration system is overloaded, but it’s misleading to say “the country is full.” In many parts of the country, the aging population and declining birth rate have left “underpopulated cities and towns,” according to a New York Times report.
